intro: Pedicularis czuiliensis, commonly known as the Czui-lien lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling small lanterns. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
